title: Tk 8m recovered in joint raid on UPDF leader’s home in Khagrhachharhi
text:
Tk 8m recovered in joint raid on UPDF leader’s home in Khagrhachharhi Khagrhachharhi Correspondent, bdnews24.com Previous Next The law enforcers have recovered Tk 8 million during a raid on the house of a leader of United Peoples’ Democratic Front (UPDF) in Khagrhachharhi. 
Khagrhachharhi Sadar Police Station OC Tareq Mohammad Abdul Hannan said the house of UPDF ‘military wing chief’ Pradeepan Kheesa was raided early on Friday. 
Pradeepan could not be detained, he added. 
The OC said a team of the ‘joint force’ acting on a tip-off conducted the raid and found the money and ‘significant documents’ hidden in tiffin boxes, pressure cooker and almirah in the house. 
UPDF collected the money by extorting the local businessmen, the police official claimed. 
UPDF, however, termed the incident ‘army attack’. 
The organisation’s Publication and Publicity Secretary Niron Chakma said in a statement that the money was collected from the masses of the area to distribute among the victims of an incident in which nine people were run over and killed while many others were injured by a truck in Alutila a few days ago. 
“An army team has snatched the money away from Pradeepan Kheesa’s house. They also vandalised the furniture in the house,” Niron said. 
UPDF demanded the money be returned.
